SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.utils

Record Class CardLocation

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
it.polimi.ingsw.utils.CardLocation
Record Components:
x - the horizontal coordinate of the card's location
y - the vertical coordinate of the card's location
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public record CardLocation(int x, int y) extends Record implements Serializable
Record that allows to describe the location on the player's board of a placed card. It can only contain legal coordinates.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • CardLocation

      public CardLocation(int x, int y)
      Builds a new CardLocation element. Because of how the cards are represented on the board, two coordinates are a valid cards location only if they're both odd or both even.
      Parameters:
      x - the horizontal coordinate of the card's location
      y - the vertical coordinate of the card's location
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided coordinates are not valid

  • Method Details

    • add

      public CardLocation add(CardLocation c)
      Creates a new CardLocation as the sum of the current object and the given one. Since we assume that both object are valid (since they can't be created otherwise), the result will always be a valid CardLocation.
      Parameters:
      c - CardLocation object to add to the current one.
      Returns:
      a new CardLocation object representing the sum of the current and the given one.

    • add

      public CardLocation add(int dx, int dy)
      Creates a new CardLocation as the sum of the current object and the given coordinates' deltas. If the deltas are invalid (the first even and the second odd, or vice versa) an exception will be launched by the constructor.
      Parameters:
      dx - the horizontal coordinate's delta
      dy - the vertical coordinate's delta
      Returns:
      a new CardLocation object representing the sum of the current one and the given deltas

    • sub

      public CardLocation sub(CardLocation c)
      Creates a new CardLocation as the subtraction of the given object from the current one. Since we assume that both object are valid (since they can't be created otherwise), the result will always be a valid CardLocation.
      Parameters:
      c - CardLocation object to subtract from the current one.
      Returns:
      a new CardLocation object representing the subtraction of the given from the current one.

    • sub

      public CardLocation sub(int dx, int dy)
      Creates a new CardLocation as the subtraction from the current object of the given coordinates' deltas. If the deltas are invalid (the first even and the second odd, or vice versa) an exception will be launched by the constructor.
      Parameters:
      dx - the horizontal coordinate's delta
      dy - the vertical coordinate's delta
      Returns:
      a new CardLocation object representing the subtraction from the current one of the given deltas

    • topLeftNeighbour

      public CardLocation topLeftNeighbour()
      Return the location of the top-left neighbour of the cards which location is the current one.

      the location of the top-left neighbour

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with '=='.
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:

      Returns:
